title: In Beijing, the EU-China summit promises to be difficult
summary: The meeting between the two powers in the Chinese capital on December 7 and 8 is unlikely to ease their mutual grievances, writes Frédéric Lemaître, Beijing correspondent for 'Le Monde.'

title: Israel is using AI to calculate bombing targets in Gaza
summary: The Israeli Defense Forces have been using AI to increase its number of targets, despite severe collateral damage.

title: Three killed, one severely injured in University of Nevada, Las Vegas mass shooting
summary: The attack sent police swarming onto the campus on Wednesday while students barricaded themselves in classrooms. Police haven’t released the identity of the shooter, who was found dead, or the motive for the attack.

title: UK immigration minister Robert Jenrick quits over Rwanda bill
summary: The bombshell resignation came after Rwanda warned that it would pull out of a treaty to accept migrants if the UK does not respect international law.

title: What is Iran's 'Axis of Resistance' against Israel and the United States?
summary: Since 1979, Tehran has skillfully and opportunistically built up a diverse network of armed groups by exploiting the political and military vulnerabilities of its neighbors.

title: How to 'prove genocide'? Ukrainian criminal investigators find new ways to try and expose Russian war crimes
summary: 'Road Map' is a software program developed by a Ukrainian official that shows a detailed database listing 230,000 Russian soldiers, their chain of command, and their suspected crimes.

title: Paris knife attacker charged with terror offenses
summary: The attacker, who killed one man and injured two other people, was charged for 'murder and attempted murder in connection with a terrorist enterprise,' for 'recidivism,' and for 'criminal terrorist conspiracy.'

title: Former Peruvian President Alberto Fujimori is freed from prison on humanitarian grounds
summary: Fujimori, 85, was serving a 25-year sentence in connection with the slayings of 25 Peruvians by death squads in the 1990s. Peru’s constitutional court ordered his immediate release on Tuesday, but the Inter-American Court of Human Rights asked for a delay to study the ruling.

title: Ousted US House speaker McCarthy to leave Congress at end of year
summary: Republican Representative Kevin McCarthy ascended through state and national politics to become second in line to the presidency before a contingent of hard-right conservatives engineered his removal in October.

title: Disgraced former Spanish football chief 'forcefully kissed' England star Lucy Bronze
summary: According to a testimony submitted to Fifa by Football Association chair Debbie Hewitt, Luis Rubiales behaved inappropriately towards several England players after the Women's World Cup final.

title: Biden urges Congress to pass Ukraine aid: 'This cannot wait'
summary: Joe Biden was speaking after a video summit with Ukrainian President Volodymyr Zelensky and the leaders of G7 nations to discuss how to shore up Western aid for Kyiv.

title: French actor Gérard Depardieu faces new sexual assault allegation
summary: Hélène Darras said that Depardieu assaulted her while filming a movie in 2007, Paris prosecutors said.

title: Boris Johnson gives evidence at UK Covid inquiry: 'We got some things wrong'
summary: The former prime minister arrived around three hours early for the proceedings, with some suggesting he was eager to avoid relatives of the Covid bereaved who gathered outside later in the morning.

title: Sderot, Gaza's Israeli neighbor, remains frozen in the terror of October 7
summary: The city was attacked on October 7 and is regularly targeted by Hamas's rockets. It has been emptied of its inhabitants, and those who remain cannot imagine a future without the destruction of the Palestinian Islamist movement.

title: Taylor Swift named Time person of the year
summary: 2023 has been a successful year for Swift, with her 'Eras' tour generating around $1.9 billion in revenue. Time called her 'the writer and hero of her own story.'

title: US charges four pro-Russian troops in Ukraine with war crimes
summary: The four 'Russian-affiliated military personnel' have been charged with three war crimes – unlawful confinement, torture, and inhuman treatment – and one count of conspiracy to commit war crimes.

title: Two of France's major arts establishments to merge in 2025
summary: Bringing together the Mobilier National and Cité de la Céramique, a new public body is part of the French Culture Ministry's plan to enhance the status of arts and crafts.

title: Europe still buying products made with Uyghur forced labor, says study
summary: A report commissioned by a group of EU lawmakers found 39 clothing brands known in Europe were at 'high risk of sourcing apparel made by Uyghurs compelled to participate in state-imposed labor transfers.'

title: COP28 conference claims to be 'inclusive' in state where dissenting voices are muzzled
summary: Local civil society has been largely absent from the global climate conference, which is hosting a record number of accredited attendees. Demonstrations by international NGOs are being tightly controlled.

title: Paris 2024: In Teahupo'o, Olympic surfing events are increasingly contested
summary: Work to install the judges' tower, due to start on December 4, was postponed after an incident involving coral blocks. The Polynesian president is once again questioning whether the event should go ahead.

title: Germany's budget constraints raise concerns in the European Union
summary: The decision of the German Constitutional Court on November 15 blocking the reallocation of funds is expected to have major consequences. The meeting of European finance ministers scheduled for Thursday, December 7, and Friday, December 8, in Brussels will serve as a test.

title: Rivalry grows between Zelensky and Ukraine's top general
summary: Ukraine's commander-in-chief Valeriy Zaluzhny has been irritating the Ukrainian president, who has been closely involved in military affairs to the point of 'creating parallel channels of communication' with commanders.

title: Senate Republicans block Ukraine and Israel aid from advancing as they demand border policy changes
summary: The vote, a 49-51 tally that fell short of the Senate’s 60-vote threshold for moving ahead, came just hours after Biden said it was 'stunning' that Congress has not yet approved tens of billions of dollars in military and economic assistance for Ukraine.

title: Seychelles declares state of emergency
summary: The statement by President Wavel Ramkalawan came after an explosion at an explosives store and flooding due to heavy rainfall, and ordered all residents except essential workers to stay at home.

title: Paris knife attacker had planned to target a Jewish site
summary: Armand Rajabpour-Miyandoab was charged with terror offenses on Wednesday evening. He said he had initially considered carrying out his attack on a memorial garden near the Eiffel Tower in memory of Jewish children deported to Auschwitz.

title: EU-China summit's 'warm welcome' rocked by China's tensions with Italy
summary: Although European Council President Charles Michel said the EU sought a 'stable and mutually beneficial' relationship with China, Italy's withdrawal from China's Belt and Road Initiative provoked fresh tensions.

title: US military grounds fleet of Osprey after crash off Japan
summary: The US military announced it was grounding its fleet of V-22 Osprey aircraft following a deadly crash last week off the coast of Japan.

title: Niger chooses Russia over Europe
summary: The junta in Niamey denounced security cooperation agreements with Europe and received a Russian official with great fanfare, imitating the military rulers of Mali and Burkina Faso.

title: Russia sets date for presidential election for March 17, 2024
summary: Vladimir Putin, 71, hasn't yet announced his intention to run again but is eligible to hold office until 2036, after the constitutional reforms he orchestrated.

title: Russian schoolgirl shoots classmates, killing one and herself
summary: State news agencies and authorities said that a 14-year-old girl in Bryansk brought a shotgun to school and opened fire on her classmates.

title: The dark side of eating frogs: Animal suffering and declining amphibian populations
summary: An investigation by PETA reveals the conditions under which amphibians are captured and slaughtered in Indonesia, the world's leading exporter of frog legs, whose main market is France.

title: Le Pen and her party increasingly seen as capable of governing
summary: Le Monde and Franceinfo's annual survey reveals that for the first time, more than half of French people believe that the far-right Rassemblement National is capable of participating in government.

title: Putin, on rare foreign trip, seeks to strengthen financial partnerships in Gulf states
summary: The Russian president visited the United Arab Emirates and Saudi Arabia, two states that have not applied sanctions imposed on Moscow over its invasion of Ukraine.

title: Israeli troops advance into Khan Yunis in Gaza's south
summary: While Israel's troops continue to conquer Gaza City in the north of the enclave, the military is also advancing into the south, where hundreds of thousands of refugees are massing with nowhere to go.

title: Students occupy Sciences Po after director's arrest for domestic violence
summary: Mathias Vicherat and his partner accused each other of domestic violence and were taken into custody on the evening of December 3, and released the next day.

title: British poet and activist Benjamin Zephaniah dies aged 65
summary: The British dub poet who drew huge inspiration from his Caribbean roots and turned down his OBE has died eight weeks after being diagnosed with a brain tumor.

title: COP28: Opposite positions on fossil fuels divide the UN climate conference
summary: After an initial period of several breakthroughs, negotiations have stalled on the major issue of the future of fossil fuels, with some countries remaining fiercely hostile to any mention of the subject.

title: Macron to meet Orban seeking breakthrough on EU's Ukraine aid impasse
summary: The French president hosts his Hungarian counterpart to encourage him not to delay key Ukraine decisions about EU membership and financial aid.

title: Israel-Hamas war: Guterres goes all-in to call for ceasefire
summary: For the first time in 52 years, the secretary-general of the United Nations invoked Article 99 of the UN Charter to urge the Security Council to vote on a ceasefire in Gaza, at a time when relations between Israel and the organization have never been so tense.

title: French government locks horns with Paris city hall over plans to lower ring road speed
summary: Mayor Anne Hidalgo's contested plan is to lower the speed limit from 70 km/h to 50 km/h after the 2024 Olympic Games.

title: PSG sells minority stake to US firm Arctos Partners
summary: Qatar Sports Investments sold part of the club to the investment firm, which has experience in more than 20 professional sports organizations.

title: UK accuses Russia of cyber campaign against top politicians
summary: The British foreign ministry said Russia's Federal Security Service (FSB) said it had summoned Russia's ambassador to London about the issue.

title: Depardieu's out-of-control sexual behavior under spotlight in TV report
summary: A new TV investigation reveals footage of the French actor repeatedly making sexual remarks to women during a trip to North Korea in 2018 and new testimonies from several women who accuse him of assault or rape.

title: 'We don't want war in South America,' says Brazil's Lula on growing Guyana-Venezuela crisis
summary: The two countries are disputing ownership of an oil-rich region currently under Guyanese administration but claimed by Venezuela.

title: Denmark adopts law banning Quran burnings
summary: The Danish parliament put through a new law making it forbidden to burn, tear or otherwise defile holy texts publicly or in videos intended to be widely disseminated.

title: French activists demand Biarritz changes 'racist' district name
summary: A petition was filed on Thursday to change the name of 'La Négresse' neighborhood' and a street with the same name in the seaside town of Biarritz.

title: French police arrest two for bedbug scam
summary: The two men were arrested for defrauding the elderly by selling unnecessary but expensive bedbug pest control services.

title: 'Putin and Netanyahu are betting on the Trump horse'
summary: World affairs must be watched keeping in mind that Donal Trump could return to the White House, writes Le Monde columnist Alain Frachon.

title: Tesla loses legal action in Sweden over postal dispute
summary: The court decision was the latest twist in an ongoing dispute between the Elon Musk-owned electric carmaker and almost a dozen unions.

title: In Paris, The Conran Shop will close its doors for good by the end of December
summary: Opened in 1992, the furniture and design store has faced a deficit for several years.
